action.action-desc: Mr. Bennet introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend and increase expensing limitations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Expensing Act of 2015.

section.header: Expensing certain depreciable business assets for small business

paragraph.text: Section 179(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking shall not exceed— and all that follows and inserting shall not exceed $1,000,000..
Section 179(b)(2) of such Code is amended by striking exceeds— and all that follows and inserting exceeds $2,500,000..

subsection.text: Section 179(d)(1)(A)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking , to which section 167 applies, and which is placed in service in a taxable year beginning after 2002 and before 2015 and inserting and to which section 167 applies.
Section 179(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking may not be revoked and all that follows through and before 2015; and
by striking irrevocable in the heading thereof.

subsection.text: Section 179(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking beginning after 2009 and before 2015 in paragraph (1); and

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
